sen.j: 平 盛嗣（たいら の もりつぐ、生年不詳 - 建久5年（1194年））は、平安時代末期の伊勢平氏方の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Moritsugu (year of birth unknown-1194) is a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) during the end of Heian period.
TAIRA no Moritsugu (year of birth unknown-1194) was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) during the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: 過去の事実なので過去形にしました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Moritsugu (year of birth unknown-1194) was a busho (Japanese military commander) of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) during the end of Heian period.

sen.j: 父・平盛俊同様平家の郎党として勇名を馳せた。
sen.e: He won a name for himself as a retainer of the Taira family, as his father, TAIRA no Moritoshi had done.
He won a name for himself as a retainer of the Taira family, as his father, TAIRA no Moritoshi had done.
He won a name for himself as a retainer of the Taira family, as his father, TAIRA no Moritoshi had done.

sen.j: 通称は越中次郎兵衛盛嗣。
sen.e: His common name was Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province.
His common name was Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province.
His common name was Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province.

sen.j: 『平家物語』では「越中次郎兵衛盛嗣」の通称で呼ばれ、平家においてその豪勇を称えられる名将であった。
sen.e: He was referred as 'Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province' in "The Tale of the Heike" and he was a great commander in the Taira family.
He was referred to as 'Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province' in "The Tale of the Heike" and he was a great commander in the Taira family.
sen.cmt: referred to asのtoが抜けていたので加えました。
sen.e: He was referred to as 'Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province' in "The Tale of the Heike" and he was a great commander in the Taira family.

sen.j: 源氏との数々の戦に参戦し、屋島の戦いでは源義経の郎党である伊勢義盛との詞戦（簡単に言えば嘲笑合戦）の逸話を残している。
sen.e: He took part in many battles against the Minamoto clan and has left an anecdote of a mockery battle against Yoshimori ISE who was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in the Battle of Yashima.
He took part in many battles against the Minamoto clan and left an anecdote of a mockery battle against Yoshimori ISE, who was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, in the Battle of Yashima.
sen.cmt: has leftの現在完了はおかしいので、過去形にしました。又、Yoshimori ISEは固有名詞なのでカンマを加え非制限用法の関係詞にしました。
sen.e: He took part in many battles against the Minamoto clan and left an anecdote of a mockery battle against Yoshimori ISE, who was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, in the Battle of Yashima.

sen.j: 寿永4年（1185年）の壇ノ浦の戦いで、彼は自害を快く思わず、京の都に落ち延び、その後但馬国で潜伏生活へ入った。
sen.e: In 1185, in the naval battle of Danno-ura, he was not fond of suicide so escaped to the capital of Kyo and later he kept himself hidden in Tajima province.
In 1185, in the naval battle of Danno-ura, he disdained to commit suicide so escaped to the capital of Kyo and later he kept himself hidden in Tajima province.
sen.cmt: 「自害を快く思わず」の表現を修正しました。
sen.e: In the naval battle of Dannoura in 1185, he did not feel comfortable to commit suicide so he escaped to Kyoto and kept himself hidden in Tajima province.
sen.cmt: Disdain だと軽蔑する、という意味もありますが、文脈からだと要するに自害したくなかったということなので、表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 盛嗣は城崎郡気比庄を本拠とする日下部道弘（気比道弘）に身分を偽り、馬飼いとして仕えたと言われている。
sen.e: Moritsugu disguised himself as Michihiro KUSAKABE (Michihiro Kehi) who was headquartered in Kehisho, Kinosaki Gun, and served as a horse breeder.
sen.cmt: 気比道弘の読み方がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Moritsugu disguised himself as Michihiro KUSAKABE (Michihiro Kehi), whose domicile was in Kehisho, Kinosaki Gun, and served as a horse breeder.
sen.cmt: 個人が「本拠とする」のでwas headquartered から whose domicileにしました。
sen.e: Moritsugu disguised himself as Michihiro KUSAKABE (Michihiro Kehi), whose domicile was in Kehisho, Kinosaki Gun, and served as a horse breeder.

sen.j: その後盛嗣は道弘の娘婿となり、平穏な落人生活を送っている。
sen.e: Later on, he became Michihiro's adopted son-in-law and spent a peaceful life.
Later on, he became Michihiro's adopted son-in-law and spent a peaceful life.

sen.j: しかし源氏側は盛嗣の行方を厳しく追及しており、源頼朝は「越中次郎兵衛盛嗣、搦めても誅してもまいらせたる者には勧賞あるべし」と皆に披露したとされる記述が『平家物語』（延慶本）にもある。
sen.e: However, the Minamoto clan pursued Moritsugu's whereabouts strictly and "The Tale of the Heike" mentions that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo presented to everyone that 'there will be praise and encouragement to those who capture Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province, even if he needs to be tied or killed.'

However, the Minamoto clan pursued Moritsugu's whereabouts harshly and "The Tale of the Heike" mentions that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo presented to everyone that 'there will be praise and encouragement to those who capture Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province, even if he needs to be tied or killed.'
sen.cmt: 「激しく」この場合はstrictly(厳密に）よりもharshlyの方がぴったりするように思ったので変えました。
sen.e: However, the Minamoto clan pursued Moritsugu's whereabouts harshly and "The Tale of the Heike" mentions that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo presented to everyone that 'there will be praise and encouragement to those who capture Jiro Hyoe Moritsugu of Ecchu province, even if he needs to be tied or killed.'

sen.j: 建久5年（1194年）、捕縛された状況には諸説あるものの、盛嗣は源氏方に捕縛され、鎌倉に送られることとなった。
sen.e: There are various theories regarding Moritsugu's capture but he was caught by the Minamoto clan and sent to Kamakura.
There are various theories regarding Moritsugu's capture but he was caught by the Minamoto clan and sent to Kamakura.
There are various theories regarding Moritsugu's capture but he was caught by the Minamoto clan and sent to Kamakura.

sen.j: 盛嗣は源頼朝の面前に引き出された際に「今は運尽きてかように搦め召し候上は、力及び候はず。とくとく道を召せ」と堂々と自説を述べ、ついに由比ヶ浜にて斬首された。
sen.e: When Moritsugu faced MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, he voiced his opinion fairly and squarely; 'I have run out of luck and there is nothing I can do under captivity. Tell me what you are going to do' and he was beheaded at Yuigahama in the end.
